case_vignette: A 19-year-old man comes to the emergency department for right wrist pain and swelling 2 hours after falling on an outstretched hand while playing softball. The pain worsened when he attempted to pitch after the fall. He has eczema and type 1 diabetes mellitus. Current medications include insulin and topical clobetasol. He appears uncomfortable. Examination shows multiple lichenified lesions over his forearms. The right wrist is swollen and tender; range of motion is limited by pain. There is tenderness to palpation in the area between the tendons of the abductor pollicis longus, extensor pollicis brevis, and extensor pollicis longus muscle. The thumb can be opposed actively towards the other fingers. Muscle strength of the right hand is decreased.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have right wrist pain and swelling since I fell while playing softball.
How long ago did the fall occur?
The fall happened 2 hours ago.
Did you hear any sound from the wrist when you fell, like a crack or a pop?
No, I didn't mention hearing any sound from my wrist when I fell.
Can you move your wrist, or is the movement limited due to pain or swelling?
My wrist movement is limited by pain.
Have you noticed any bruising, redness, or deformity in the wrist area?
I didn't mention any bruising, redness, or deformity specifically, just swelling and tenderness.
Do you have any previous medical history of bone diseases or conditions that could affect your bones?
I have eczema and type 1 diabetes, but no bone diseases mentioned.
Are you experiencing any numbness or tingling in your fingers?
I didn't mention experiencing any numbness or tingling in my fingers.
Are you currently experiencing any difficulties in breathing or chest pain?
No, I didn't mention any breathing difficulties or chest pain.
Are you able to grip objects or make a fist with the affected hand?
My muscle strength in the right hand is decreased.
Have you taken any medication or treatment for the pain and swelling since the fall?
I am currently on insulin and topical clobetasol for my other conditions, but I didn't mention taking anything for the pain and swelling since the fall.
**Final Diagnosis:** Wrist sprain likely, suggest immediate medical evaluation for possible fracture due to diabetes possibly affecting bone health.
